subject: News Summary
body:
CBSNews.com






May 7, 2007


                              		
                              		
                              	  Home | U.S. | World | Politics | SciTech | Health | Entertainment | Business | Opinion | Sports | Blogs | Interactives | Video

TOP STORIESKansas Tornado Survivors Return To Ruin
Residents of a Kansas town left mostly destroyed after a devastating F-5 tornado will be allowed to visit their homes today.
                        Meanwhile, rescue workers continued to search for more victims as the storm's death toll reached 10. More...Watch: Storm Decimates Kansas Town
• Spider-Man 3 Smashes Box Office Records• France Elects U.S.-Friendly Conservative
                     					| Watch• Bush's GOP War Support Fading?U.S.A Thrift-Shop Jackson Pollock Masterpiece?
Teri Horton knew nothing about art when she bought a big, drippy painting for $5 years ago in a thrift store. But now she
                        says a fingerprint proves it is a $50 million Jackson Pollock original. CNN's Anderson Cooper reports.  More...Watch: Thrift Store Masterpiece?
• Kansas Tornado Survivors Return To Ruin
                     					| Watch• LAPD Acts Against Elite Police Squad• Lou Dobbs, "Advocacy" Journalist?
                     					| Watch• More StoriesWorldFrance Elects U.S.-Friendly Conservative
Nicolas Sarkozy, a blunt and uncompromising pro-American conservative, has won the French presidency. Scattered protests greeted
                        the new leader, who now must unite a divided public to tackle tough issues including immigration and a sluggish economy. More...Watch: France Elects Next President
• Switching Sides: Inside The Enemy Camp• Iraq's Christian Minority Flees Violence• New Bombs After Bloody Sunday In Iraq• More StoriesPoliticsBush's GOP War Support Fading?
The House Republican leader has said President Bush could lose the support of his party if the chosen path in Iraq doesn't
                        bare fruit by this fall. However, Minority Leader John Boehner said Mr. Bush's "surge" plan deserves a chance to work. More...
• Gingrich: No '08 Decision Until September
                     					| Watch• Obama Carefully Courts Jewish Vote
                     					| Watch• Rangel: Bush Must Compromise On Iraq
                     					| Watch• More StoriesHealthParents Can Make Shots Easier To Take
A study finds that telling jokes, reading books, bringing favorite toys from home, even blowing soap bubbles all ease children's
                        anxieties about immunizations. Apologizing or reassuring too much may make the situation worse. More...
• Younger Girls Binge Drinking More
                     					| Watch• Siblings Of Autistic Kids Also At Risk• Brazil Overrides Patent For AIDS Drug
                     					| Watch• More StoriesSciTechE-Mail Etiquette: The Do's and Don'ts
The "e" in e-mail might as well stand for "essential": Most of us have become hopelessly dependent on communicating with e-mail.
                        But as Daniel Sieberg notes, many of us can use tips on how to use this technology for good, not evil.  More...
• Dell Joins Microsoft, Novell Alliance• Fix It Or Nix It? 
                     					| Watch• Monkey In The Middle• More StoriesBusinessGas Prices Jump To New Record
Gasoline prices have surged to a record nationwide average of $3.07 per gallon, nearly 20 cents higher than two weeks earlier,
                        oil industry analyst Trilby Lundberg said Sunday. More...
• Alcoa Bids For Canadian Aluminum Rival• Dell Joins Microsoft, Novell Alliance• Financial Spiders
                     					| Watch• More StoriesEntertainmentSpider-Man 3 Smashes Box Office Records
Spider-Man caught just about everyone in his web. The superhero's latest adventure, "Spider-Man 3," smashed box-office records
                        with $148 million in its first three days, according to studio estimates Sunday. More...
• Could Jail Time Help Paris Hilton?
                     					| Watch• Benson's Not Asleep At The Wheel
                     					| Watch• It's A Summer Of Sequels
                     					| Watch• More StoriesOpinionWhat War? We Have Sanjaya!
Sunday Morning commentator Nancy Giles wonders where our priorities are. Why does the news media give as much
                        or more coverage to Alec Baldwin as it does to a war Iraq? More...

Look here for numbers to call with tips on the possible whereabouts of missing people profiled on Without A Trace,
